file_content.text: Trapped in darkness for centuries... I am finally free.
You have my thanks. Few challenge Sel-Makor's servant and survive.
Those who do are his pawns. He showed Jokull the future. The Gormak king ran screaming.
Do you know how Jokull got his power?
You saw Jokull here?
You look like a Gormak, but you talk like a Voss.
What are you, exactly?
You think of them as two nations, enemies. When I lived, all were Voss.
A Mystic's power was not always a rare thing.
The Gormak king sees visions. Beneath his skin, he is Voss still.
The Voss and the Gormak were once one people. I am their ancestor.
Are the Voss and the Gormak aware they're the same people?
Do they know this?
They have forgotten. Their hate for each other replaced the truth.
How did the Voss and the Gormak develop such different cultures?
But they're so different.
Their methods are different. They are not. Both believe there is one path to the future.
Did all Voss once look like the Gormak?
So the Gormak are older?
The Gormak came first. The Voss evolved.
Gormak, maybe. Voss, that's a stretch.
You sure don't look it.
The Voss shed their rough, warrior selves. The Gormak clung to them.
What made the Voss and the Gormak split up?
Why are they different now?
Some saw visions, gained the power to heal. Others did not. This became the great divide.
Jokull was having visions because he's really a Voss.
That explains a few things.
Jokull always had the ability. Returning here, to the heart of Voss, awakened it.
Now Voss and Gormak war against their own. Sel-Makor feeds on their hatred.
If the war continues, Sel-Makor's power will grow beyond the Nightmare Lands. The Voss and the Gormak must make peace.
Peace won't happen unless they know the truth.
They need to hear this.
You see things clearly.
Tell that to the Gormak. Or the Voss, for that matter.
Easier said than done.
I am fading fast. I cannot help in this.
You are part of a vision. An outsider will end the Gormak threat.
You must heal this wound. Tell the Voss the truth, no matter the cost.
Whatever the consequences, I'll do what's best for Voss.
You have my promise.
What is best for Voss may not be for you.
I'll tell them about the Gormak, and Sel-Makor.
What I know, I'll share.
Sel-Makor is not the only danger.
I'll give it to them straight.
I can do that much.
You must know the weight of your promise.
Just warning you, I've been known to say the wrong thing once or twice.
Maybe you should do it.
Your words are not the danger this time.
What harm could there be in ending a war?
This could cost something?
The Voss will never believe me without proof.
My word won't be enough.
They will recognize the truth. You face other challenges.
I have seen a little of this new Voss. You seek allies for your own war.
The Voss will find the truth hard to accept. They may refuse you because of it.
If I tell the truth, the Republic loses their chance at an alliance?
This will hurt the Republic?
The Voss might surprise you.
You should have some faith.
Their future depends on your words.
I won't do anything that endangers the Republic.
I need to think about this.
A Jedi is bound to serve the Republic.
That might change things.
I have to think of the Republic first.
The Voss aren't my people.
I don't like to bite the hand holding the credits.
That's a definite problem.
Would you doom our world to save your own?
This war will end in truth, or in blood. The choice will be yours.
My time to rest has come. Go well.
Fools entering the darkness. Are they Voss, or Gormak?
Another fool enters the darkness. Is it Voss? Or it is Gormak?
Ah. I have fought your kind before. You come from the stars, but you die just as easily.
Even the Gormak king fell before me. I showed him mercy. You will beg for it.
I haven't begged for mercy yet. I doubt you'll be the first.
You'll be disappointed.
Many come to the Dark Heart to test themselves. I break them all.
You'll find I have a few advantages over a Gormak.
I might surprise you.
The Gormak are more powerful than you realize.
You've obviously never fought a Republic soldier before.
I'm no Gormak king.
You will show me your weaknesses.
I'm more of a deal maker, myself.
Begging's not my style.
You are nothing but another slave.
What happened between you and the Gormak king?
You fought Jokull?
Guess again, ugly.
You fight with words, like the Voss. You are all doomed.
The desperate are drawn to the Dark Heart's power. The Gormak king was no different.
Those who seek power find ancient darkness. I serve Sel-Makor.
Who is Sel-Makor?
Is that a Voss? Or Gormak?
The dark entity at the heart of Voss. My master and yours.
What does Sel-Makor want from the Voss and the Gormak?
What does your master want?
For now, they are his prey. As my master gains strength, they will become his servants.
I'm not here to fight some lowly servant.
He should face me himself.
My master's power cannot be contained by flesh. I speak for him.
The Nightmare Lands belong to Sel-Makor. The twisted earth, the corrupted beasts, the wandering madmen... my master controls them all.
The Dark Heart cannot contain Sel-Makor. His power will grow until he consumes this world. Nothing will stop this.
The Voss will hear about Sel-Makor's plans. They'll stop him.
I'll tell the Voss everything.
The Mystics will see my master eventually. By then, it will be too late.
I wouldn't be so sure.
My master's victory is inevitable. You will understand this soon enough.
I can't stop your master, but I can kill you.
You've said enough. [Attack.]
The dark power of Sel-Makor flows through me. You will not survive.
The darkness of Sel-Makor will devour you. We are all his slaves.
I don't trust ghosts.
You think I can help?
